u_shaped_ranking.context_window: the guillemot is now probably extinct as a breeding seabird species. The species was common in the Berlengas islands (Portugal) where 6 000 breeding pairs were estimated in 1939 and on the Galician coast (Spain) in the 1940-1960 period (about 1 500 breeding pairs), but all the populations dropped dramatically from the 1960s onwards and at present all the breeding colonies have disappeared.
